Posts.Content: Cleijo wrote: Hey ladies!  This is my first post and I have been glued to the website since I found it yesterday. I had breast reduction done in May and they found a 1.4cm tumor in the tissue removed.  Since then I chose to have a double bi-lat mastectomy with TE recon on 9 June surgery.  I feel better each day but still have one drain in which is the side they did the sentinel node bio from.  It is putting out about 40cc a day and still dark in color. Yesterday my chest above my old breast area started swelling.  It is not red or inflammed just a little tight and hard.  I went to the PS yesterday and he said I was still healing and did not seemed too concerned.  He thinks I may have pulled the muscle.  I did bend over Sunday and have a sharp pain in my chest when the TE is.  Also, he did say the drain is coming out this Friday which I am hope happens.  Have any of you had this happen? Cleijo Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: upper chest swelling after bi-lat masec Cleijo Cleijo

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2010 01:03PM Cleijo wrote: Thanks everyone is so nice and supportive here!  It is great to have some encouragement when your going this stuff.  I am surpised at how many negative stories and comments you get from people and friends when they ask questions.  I have had numerous people ask why I chose to have the double mastectomy instead of just the one with BC.  I had to go into a long story of how I don't won't to worry about it coming back, both my aunts had IDC, etc...I am sure you ladies have had similiar situations.  Thanks again for the hugs, support and encouragement.  I will tune into the chemo discussions soon.
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2010 09:43PM Cleijo wrote: Sign me up for the June group.  I am new as of today but had a BMX w/TE 7 June.
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2010 05:58PM Cleijo wrote: Thanks for the welcome.  The recovery is slowly getting better each day. I am just blessed my BC was caught early and I count each day a blessing.  The post here are so real and I can relate to them.  Some make you want to laugh and some cry.  BC Women are amazing!
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2010 06:48PM Cleijo wrote: Thanks for the input.  I may be reading my path report wrong.  It says for the HER2/neu NOT OVER EXPRESSED; FAVORABLE with 1+% total score.  I really don't know what that means.  My ER and PR were positive with 98% and 80%.
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2010 12:42PM Cleijo wrote: Hey, Please add me to the group of June Mastecomy's.  I am Cleijo Gesin from Harvest, AL which is right outside of Huntsville AL.  I have joined the group but haven't logged in a couple of weeks.  I had IDC which was detected by a breast reduction and saved my life.  I had a bilateral mastectomy on 12 June with immediate reconstruction (TE).  My total BC was 2.1cm with .7mm in my SNB.  I have CT scans in the morning for lungs, liver and pelvis and prayer everything comes back clean.  Then meet with the onco again to discuss the treatment.  Looking at 4 chemo treatments 3 weeks apart.  Love this forum!  Very inspring and it is nice be able to relate to each BC lady and their story of survival! Cleijo
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac
